title: A Touch of Frost - Series 02 (1994) - 4 Episodes
description:
A Touch of Frost - (1994) Series 02 - 4 (720x544) Episodes


Series Description Courtesy Of:

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Touch_of_Frost" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Touch_of_Frost</a>


A Touch of Frost is a television detective series produced by Yorkshire Television (later ITV Studios) for ITV from 1992 until 2010, initially based on the Frost novels by R. D. Wingfield. Writing credit for the three episodes in the first 1992 series went to Richard Harris, with screenplays credited to Wingfield.

The series stars David Jason as Detective Inspector William Edward "Jack" Frost, an experienced and dedicated detective who frequently clashes with his superiors. In his cases, Frost is assisted by a variety of different detective sergeants, with each bringing a different slant to the particular case. Comic relief is provided by Frost's interactions with the bureaucratically minded Superintendent Norman Mullett, played by Bruce Alexander.

A number of young actors had their major debut as supporting cast in the show, including Matt Bardock, Ben Daniels, Neil Stuke, Mark Letheren, Colin Buchanan, Jason Maza, Damian Lewis and Marc Warren.

1994-01-09 - A Minority of One (Video:H264 720x544, 998kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 115kbps)

Frost is assigned a new, West Indian detective constable, Clive Tanner; transferred in to help him investigate a string of commercial burglaries, which leads him to a black family on the local Eastdean estate, that he calls 'the crime academy', while feeling guilt over the death of one of his informants. Will the arrest of the apparent culprit lead to accusations of police racism?


1994-01-16 - Widows and Orphans (Video:H264 720x544, 995kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 115kbps)

Frost investigates a series of break-ins and brutal attacks at the homes of elderly people. He is helped by a female detective, DS Lawson, who also offers him advice on his personal life.


1994-01-23 - Nothing to Hide (Video:H264 720x544, 999kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 100kbps)

Upon investigation, Frost discovers that the apparently accidental death of a drug addict was actually murder. He also decides to confront an aspect of his own past.


1994-01-30 - Stranger in the House (Video:H264 720x544, 1003kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 98kbps)

Frost is invited to join fellow George Cross recipients in London. He is instructed to enlist the aid of WPC Hazel Wallace as a decoy to catch a serial rapist, but it exposes her to serious danger
